data.title: Great Venue!
data.text: We went to see "Phantom" and it was enough that we are now season ticket holders. They provide a wonderful venue and production which makes for a very nice evening out. The actors are great! We saw "The 39 Steps" last night, can't wait for the next show!!

data.title: The Owen Theater
data.text: It is a great place to see some really good performances by local talent.  The price is right and it is a fun time.

data.title: Phantom was fantastic !!
data.text: I have never been disappointed with a show at The Owen. The cast of local talent is top notch. If you have not been to a play here ! Try it you will like it !

data.title: We found out about this winery Sunday at the pool with one of the guests.
data.text: We decided to go out to the winery and listen to some live music. We enjoyed this experience totally. The winery is very nice and it was a beautiful place. The weather was not cooperating but the folks up there made the absolute best of things. We met really nice folks, saw some great music and enjoyed the wines we tried. The sunset toast was folksy and relaxing. I can't say enough about the owners and the staff. All friendly, relaxing atmosphere and a genuine pleasure. We are looking into going up and staying onsite for a weekend.

data.title: Great community theater...
data.text: Owen theater has, for years, our source for great community entertainment. Very accessible and very reasonable. Casts are very good

data.title: Season ticket holders
data.text: Three years running and still enjoying the talented and skilled performers and artisans delivering high quality acting, sets, and costumes.  We happen to know both artists who do the costumes - they are both tops.  Some many good actors and a few truly great. Great variety, comfortable seating, priced right, and entertaining every time. What are you waiting for??

data.title: Entertaining
data.text: Great shows, children's productions were awesome. Great way to suport  the town and children. Highly recommended.

data.title: Fun and easy entertainment
data.text: We saw "Murder at the Howard Johnson's" with a cast of three good actors performing a bit of intrigue/comedy in 3 acts that kept on pace and kept the audience laughing.  Good quality community theater.  For not much more than a movie ticket, it was a good change of pace.  The venue is simple, old style movie theater with maybe 15 rows and 400 capacity and visibility to the stage from every seat.  Ample parking right across the street and easy access to and from I-45,  There is a good restaurant, sweets shop,  and an art gallery about a block away for somethings to do before the show.

data.title: Excellent Entertainment
data.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the theater presentation of "Murder At The Howard Johnson's".  The entertainment was very enjoyable and the venue was terrific.  The seating is comfortable, great sound and the performers were top drawer.  The ticket costs were very reasonable (i.e. $20 each). I would highly recommend visiting the Owen Theater as they have several shows scheduled in the coming months.

data.title: Great inexpensive entertainment
data.text: This community theatre puts on 7 plays a season and does a professional job of it.  The building was converted to a state of the art 250 seat venue a few years ago and has had more renovations since to improve the experience.  Tickets are only $ 22 and including the show on a date night can be a winning combination.  I have included a picture of a set being built from a previous production they did.

data.title: Great community theater
data.text: We have been season ticket holders for about 6 years.  The quality of their productions never ceases to amaze us.   I

data.title: Nicely done !
data.text:
When the 1st talk of adding a 2nd theater in downtown Conroe came up , my initial reaction was, WHY?
We already have the historic Crighton & it's not fully utilized.
They went ahead with the Owen project & they did a wonderful job renovating the old Trailways bus terminal.
The results are very good, but the ? Remains.,,, we now have 2 under utilized theatres in downtown Conroe. 
They even took the Crighton Players out of the Crighton to fill what dates they do use.
While it does beat an empty building falling into later stages of disrepair, I still question the reasoning.

data.title: Good local theater
data.text: There's not a bad seat in the house at the Owen.  The shows are enjoyable and the lead players are generally very good.  I have been impressed by the creativity of the set designs.  They enhance the show in surprising ways.  A few of the show choices seem questionable, but enough are fun for us to purchase season tickets.  It's an enjoyable evening out.

data.title: great place to see a live play
data.text: wonderful venue. right in the square. easy to find. very clean. roomie theater. will go again. they have great shows there. also they offer season tickets

data.title: Great Plays go on Here
data.text: The plays I have seen here have been great. The theatre is more like a school auditorium though as far as what it looks like. It does not take away from the great performances but just has a different feel.

data.title: Excellent production of Oklahoma
data.text:
Went with a group to see Sunday matinee performance of Roger's and Hammerstein's Oklahoma. What a superb show. The singers's all had wonderful voices and played their parts well. A few were featured dancers and really did things well. Acoustics were all well balanced and sound quality was excellent.

The main players were excellent and did really well. The principle villain was great and easy to dislike. The props were simple but did the necessary job.

One must remember this is a small town theater with a limited budget and not TUTS from down in Houston. I highly recommend this production as one to see. If one cannot get to see this one, they have others coming up. Just go to some .

data.title: Almost Maine
data.text: I have to say I'm not much into going downtown Conroe, at night for anything.  We went with some friends on a Saturday night for the show.  The theater resembled an old bus station on the outside.  Parking was free and plentiful.  We felt very secure walking to the event.  Once inside we were greeted with a smile by the ushers and had our pictures taken for Valentines day.  The seats were nice.  The show was interesting.  I think the crew did a great job.  We would consider going again.  It was a nice night out.  I will say the room was probably all 50 and over.  I didn't see any kids.  Not that it means anything, it just might have been that show.  I give it a 5. Good time.

data.title: Fun time.
data.text: Conroe is not only about the lake or golf.It has a great theatre to have fun and a few laughs too. I just happened to see Guys and Dolls at the Owen Theatre . It is a romantic musical comedy and it was wonderful. I was impressed by the cast and great dancers who keep my three sons and I interested to the end.I will also tell you that I will continue supporting this theatre and let my friends know  to go there when they are in Conroe.
